content.question: ​The function <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator 2 x squared minus 5 x plus 3 over denominator x plus 2 end fraction"><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></math>. In the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane, the graph of <math alttext="f"><mi>f</mi></math> has a slant asymptote. Which of the following is an equation for the slant asymptote?

topic.text: 1.11: Equivalent Representations of Polynomial and Rational Expressions

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
